results.title: Child of urban Thailand: a place to live
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte, South Pacific Television and World Vision of New Zealand
results.brief_description: Highlights a day in the life of a ten-year-old boy who lives in the slums of Bangkok, Thailand. Examines the problems of rural people who have moved to the city without job skills or money. Motivates discussion about the rights and responsibilities of children in different types of family and community situations. Helps to build understanding and appreciation of other cultures. Stimulates concern for children who are denied basic rights and opportunities. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Whyte, South Pacific Television and World Vision of New Zealand

results.title: Challenge over the Atlantic
results.creator_credit: ABC Sports (US) and Vantage Communications Inc.
results.brief_description: In 1979 Ben Abruzzo, Maxie Anderson and Larry Newman flew a hot air balloon, the Double Eagle II, across the Atlantic from U.S.A. to France, succeeding where hundreds of others had failed for over a century. The factors that enabled these three to surmount an enormous challenge and succeed where others failed are the same as those required to achieve superlative goals in any field. Includes interviews with the three men who discuss their philosophies on setting goals, surmounting challenges, teamwork and superior performance.

results.title: Cerebral palsy: basic abilities
results.creator_credit: Spastic Centre of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Based on the Book “Cerebral Palsy - Basic Abilities - A plan for Training the Pre-School Child” the film carefully outlines the program used in New South Wales since 1963, in an attempt to develop visuomotor and perceptual learning skills.

results.title: Central Asia: crossroads of culture
results.creator_credit: M Raioumov and Tashkent Film Studios
results.brief_description: In the heart of Asia can be seen traces of a great civilization. The Central Asian region formed part of the Kisham Empire, comparable in greatness with that of the Romans. This film shows the relatively unknown cultural heritage of Central Asia. Made in co-operation with UNESCO and with the assistance of the National Commissions for UNESCO of Afghanistan, India, Iran, Pakistan and the USSR.

results.title: Celtic gold in Ireland
results.creator_credit: John Fitzmaurice Mills, Rex Roberts and National Museum of Ireland
results.brief_description: Shows some fine examples of prehistoric Celtic gold work, jewellery and other ornamental pieces, housed in the National Museum. The film also shows some of the places of historical interest where they were found in rural Ireland.

results.title: Cells and what they do
results.brief_description: The story of every living thing begins with the story of the living cell. Through a microscope, children see the parts of a plant cell, parts of an animal cell, the activity inside living cells, the process of cell division, and development of a fertilised egg. Suitable for primary school level.
